trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a vault
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a vault

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Expand Data Services > Recovery Services and click Site Recovery Vault.
trans-unit.target: Expand Data Services > Recovery Services and click Site Recovery Vault.

trans-unit.source: Click Create New > Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create New > Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: In Name, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.
trans-unit.target: In Name, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.

trans-unit.source: In Region, select the geographic region for the vault.
trans-unit.target: In Region, select the geographic region for the vault.

trans-unit.source: To check supported regions see Geographic Availability in <link><linkText>Azure Site Recovery Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To check supported regions see Geographic Availability in <link><linkText>Azure Site Recovery Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Click Create vault.
trans-unit.target: Click Create vault.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New vault</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New vault</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Check the status bar to confirm that the vault was successfully created.
trans-unit.target: Check the status bar to confirm that the vault was successfully created.

trans-unit.source: The vault will be listed as Active on the main Recovery Services page.
trans-unit.target: The vault will be listed as Active on the main Recovery Services page.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Deploy a configuration server
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Deploy a configuration server

trans-unit.source: Configure server settings
trans-unit.target: Configure server settings

trans-unit.source: In the Recovery Services page, click the vault to open the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: In the Recovery Services page, click the vault to open the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start can also be opened at any time using the icon.
trans-unit.target: Quick Start can also be opened at any time using the icon.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Quick Start Icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Quick Start Icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the dropdown list, select Between an on-premises site with VMware/physical servers and Azure.
trans-unit.target: In the dropdown list, select Between an on-premises site with VMware/physical servers and Azure.

trans-unit.source: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources click Deploy Configuration Server.
trans-unit.target: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources click Deploy Configuration Server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy configuration server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy configuration server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In New Configuration Server Details specify:
trans-unit.target: In New Configuration Server Details specify:

trans-unit.source: A name for the configuration server and credentials to connect to it.
trans-unit.target: A name for the configuration server and credentials to connect to it.

trans-unit.source: In the network connectivity type drop down select Public Internet or VPN.
trans-unit.target: In the network connectivity type drop down select Public Internet or VPN.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This setting is a deployment time choice you make and cannot be changed later.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This setting is a deployment time choice you make and cannot be changed later.

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure network on which the server should be located.
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure network on which the server should be located.

trans-unit.source: If you specified VPN as the network connectivity type ensure that this Azure vnet is connected to your on-premises site over an ExpressRoute connection or a site-to-site VPN.
trans-unit.target: If you specified VPN as the network connectivity type ensure that this Azure vnet is connected to your on-premises site over an ExpressRoute connection or a site-to-site VPN.

trans-unit.source: Specify the internal IP address and subnet to assign to the server.
trans-unit.target: Specify the internal IP address and subnet to assign to the server.

trans-unit.source: Note that the first four IP addresses in any subnet are reserved for internal Azure usage.
trans-unit.target: Note that the first four IP addresses in any subnet are reserved for internal Azure usage.

trans-unit.source: Use any other available IP address.
trans-unit.target: Use any other available IP address.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy configuration server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy configuration server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you click OK a standard A3 virtual machine based on an Azure Site Recovery Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image will be created in your subscription for the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: When you click OK a standard A3 virtual machine based on an Azure Site Recovery Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image will be created in your subscription for the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: It's created as the first instance in a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: It's created as the first instance in a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: If you specified the network connectivity type to be Public Internet the cloud service is created with a reserved public IP address.
trans-unit.target: If you specified the network connectivity type to be Public Internet the cloud service is created with a reserved public IP address.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor progress in the Jobs tab.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor progress in the Jobs tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor progress</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor progress</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This step is applicable only if your connectivity type is Public Internet. After the configuration server is deployed note the public IP address assigned to it on the Virtual Machines page in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This step is applicable only if your connectivity type is Public Internet. After the configuration server is deployed note the public IP address assigned to it on the Virtual Machines page in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Then on the Endpoints tab note the public HTTPS port mapped to private port 443.
trans-unit.target: Then on the Endpoints tab note the public HTTPS port mapped to private port 443.

trans-unit.source: You'll need this information later when you register the master target and process servers with the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: You'll need this information later when you register the master target and process servers with the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: The configuration server is deployed with these endpoints:
trans-unit.target: The configuration server is deployed with these endpoints:

trans-unit.source: HTTPS: Public port is used to coordinate communication between component servers and Azure over the internet.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS: Public port is used to coordinate communication between component servers and Azure over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Private port 443 is used to coordinate communication between component servers and Azure over VPN.
trans-unit.target: Private port 443 is used to coordinate communication between component servers and Azure over VPN.

trans-unit.source: Custom: Public port is used for failback tool communication over the inter
trans-unit.target: Custom: Public port is used for failback tool communication over the inter

trans-unit.source: net.
trans-unit.target: net.

trans-unit.source: Private port 9443 is used for failback tool communication over VPN.
trans-unit.target: Private port 9443 is used for failback tool communication over VPN.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell: Private port 5986
trans-unit.target: PowerShell: Private port 5986

trans-unit.source: Remote desktop: Private port 3389
trans-unit.target: Remote desktop: Private port 3389

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VM endpoints</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM endpoints</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Don't delete or change the public or private port number of any of the endpoints created during configuration server deployment.
trans-unit.target: Don't delete or change the public or private port number of any of the endpoints created during configuration server deployment.

trans-unit.source: The configuration server is deployed in an automatically created Azure cloud service with a reserved IP address.
trans-unit.target: The configuration server is deployed in an automatically created Azure cloud service with a reserved IP address.

trans-unit.source: The reserved address is needed to ensure that the Configuration Server cloud service IP address remains the same across reboots of the virtual machines (including the configuration server) on the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The reserved address is needed to ensure that the Configuration Server cloud service IP address remains the same across reboots of the virtual machines (including the configuration server) on the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The reserved public IP address will need to be manually unreserved when the configuration server is decommissioned or it'll remain reserved.
trans-unit.target: The reserved public IP address will need to be manually unreserved when the configuration server is decommissioned or it'll remain reserved.

trans-unit.source: There's a default limit of 20 reserved public IP addresses per subscription.
trans-unit.target: There's a default limit of 20 reserved public IP addresses per subscription.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Find out more</linkText><title></title></link> about reserved IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Find out more</linkText><title></title></link> about reserved IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Register the configuration server in the vault
trans-unit.target: Register the configuration server in the vault

trans-unit.source: In the Quick Start page click Prepare Target Resources > Download a registration key.
trans-unit.target: In the Quick Start page click Prepare Target Resources > Download a registration key.

trans-unit.source: The key file is generated automatically.
trans-unit.target: The key file is generated automatically.

trans-unit.source: It's valid for 5 days after it's generated.
trans-unit.target: It's valid for 5 days after it's generated.

trans-unit.source: Copy it to the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: Copy it to the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: In Virtual Machines select the configuration server from the virtual machines list.
trans-unit.target: In Virtual Machines select the configuration server from the virtual machines list.

trans-unit.source: Open the Dashboard tab and click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Open the Dashboard tab and click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Open the downloaded RDP file to log onto the configuration server using Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open the downloaded RDP file to log onto the configuration server using Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: If your Configuration server is deployed on a VPN network, use the internal IP address (this is the IP address you specified when you deployed the configuration server and can also be seen on the virtual machines dashboard page for the configuration server virtual machine) of the configuration server to Remote desktop to it from your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: If your Configuration server is deployed on a VPN network, use the internal IP address (this is the IP address you specified when you deployed the configuration server and can also be seen on the virtual machines dashboard page for the configuration server virtual machine) of the configuration server to Remote desktop to it from your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Site Recovery Configuration Server Setup Wizard runs automatically when you log on for the first time.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Site Recovery Configuration Server Setup Wizard runs automatically when you log on for the first time.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Third-Party Software Installation click I Accept to download and install MySQL.
trans-unit.target: In Third-Party Software Installation click I Accept to download and install MySQL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MySQL install</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MySQL install</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In MySQL Server Details create credentials to log onto the MySQL server instance.
trans-unit.target: In MySQL Server Details create credentials to log onto the MySQL server instance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MySQL credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MySQL credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Internet Settings specify how the configuration server will connect to the internet.
trans-unit.target: In Internet Settings specify how the configuration server will connect to the internet.

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a custom proxy you should set it up before you install the Provider.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a custom proxy you should set it up before you install the Provider.

trans-unit.source: When you click Next a test will run to check the proxy connection.
trans-unit.target: When you click Next a test will run to check the proxy connection.

trans-unit.source: If you do use a custom proxy, or your default proxy requires authentication you'll need to enter the proxy details, including the address, port, and credentials.
trans-unit.target: If you do use a custom proxy, or your default proxy requires authentication you'll need to enter the proxy details, including the address, port, and credentials.

trans-unit.source: The following URLs should be accessible via the proxy:
trans-unit.target: The following URLs should be accessible via the proxy:

trans-unit.source: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.hypervrecoverymanager.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.accesscontrol.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.accesscontrol.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.backup.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: *.backup.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.store.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.store.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: If you have IP address-based firewall rules ensure that the rules are set to allow communication from the configuration server to the IP addresses described in <link><linkText>Azure Datacenter IP Ranges</linkText><title></title></link> and HTTPS (443) protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you have IP address-based firewall rules ensure that the rules are set to allow communication from the configuration server to the IP addresses described in <link><linkText>Azure Datacenter IP Ranges</linkText><title></title></link> and HTTPS (443) protocol.

trans-unit.source: You would have to white-list IP ranges of the Azure region that you plan to use, and that of West US.
trans-unit.target: You would have to white-list IP ranges of the Azure region that you plan to use, and that of West US.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Proxy registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Proxy registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Provider Error Message Localization Settings specify in which language you want error messages to appear.
trans-unit.target: In Provider Error Message Localization Settings specify in which language you want error messages to appear.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Error message registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Error message registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Azure Site Recovery Registration browse and select the key file you copied to the server.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Site Recovery Registration browse and select the key file you copied to the server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Key file registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Key file registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the completion page of the wizard select these options:
trans-unit.target: On the completion page of the wizard select these options:

trans-unit.source: Select Launch Account Management Dialog to specify that the Manage Accounts dialog should open after you finish the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select Launch Account Management Dialog to specify that the Manage Accounts dialog should open after you finish the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Select Create a desktop icon for Cspsconfigtool to add a desktop shortcut on the configuration server so that you can open the Manage Accounts dialog at any time without needing to rerun the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select Create a desktop icon for Cspsconfigtool to add a desktop shortcut on the configuration server so that you can open the Manage Accounts dialog at any time without needing to rerun the wizard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Complete registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Complete registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Finish to complete the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click Finish to complete the wizard.

trans-unit.source: A passphrase is generated.
trans-unit.target: A passphrase is generated.

trans-unit.source: Copy it to a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Copy it to a secure location.

trans-unit.source: You'll need it to authenticate and register the process and master target servers with the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: You'll need it to authenticate and register the process and master target servers with the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: It's also used to ensure channel integrity in configuration server communications.
trans-unit.target: It's also used to ensure channel integrity in configuration server communications.

trans-unit.source: You can regenerate the passphrase but then you'll need to re-register the master target and process servers using the new passphrase.
trans-unit.target: You can regenerate the passphrase but then you'll need to re-register the master target and process servers using the new passphrase.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Passphrase</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Passphrase</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After registration the configuration server will be listed on the Configuration Servers page in the vault.
trans-unit.target: After registration the configuration server will be listed on the Configuration Servers page in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Set up and manage accounts
trans-unit.target: Set up and manage accounts

trans-unit.source: During deployment Site Recovery requests credentials for the following actions:
trans-unit.target: During deployment Site Recovery requests credentials for the following actions:

trans-unit.source: When you add a vCenter server for automated discovery of virtual machines managed by the vCenter server.
trans-unit.target: When you add a vCenter server for automated discovery of virtual machines managed by the vCenter server.

trans-unit.source: A vCenter account is required for automated discovery of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: A vCenter account is required for automated discovery of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: When you add machines for protection, so that Site Recovery can install the Mobility service on them.
trans-unit.target: When you add machines for protection, so that Site Recovery can install the Mobility service on them.

trans-unit.source: After you've registered the configuration server you can open the Manage Accounts dialog to add and manage accounts that should be used for these actions.
trans-unit.target: After you've registered the configuration server you can open the Manage Accounts dialog to add and manage accounts that should be used for these actions.

trans-unit.source: There are a couple of ways to do this:
trans-unit.target: There are a couple of ways to do this:

trans-unit.source: Open the shortcut you opted to created for the dialog on the last page of setup for the configuration server (cspsconfigtool).
trans-unit.target: Open the shortcut you opted to created for the dialog on the last page of setup for the configuration server (cspsconfigtool).

trans-unit.source: Open the dialog on finish of configuration server setup.
trans-unit.target: Open the dialog on finish of configuration server setup.

trans-unit.source: In Manage Accounts click Add Account.
trans-unit.target: In Manage Accounts click Add Account.

trans-unit.source: You can also modify and delete existing accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can also modify and delete existing accounts.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage accounts</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage accounts</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Account Details specify an account name to use in Azure and credentials (Domain/user name).
trans-unit.target: In Account Details specify an account name to use in Azure and credentials (Domain/user name).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage accounts</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage accounts</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect to the configuration server
trans-unit.target: Connect to the configuration server

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to connect to the configuration server:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to connect to the configuration server:

trans-unit.source: Over a VPN site-to-site or ExpressRoute connection
trans-unit.target: Over a VPN site-to-site or ExpressRoute connection

trans-unit.source: Over the internet
trans-unit.target: Over the internet

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: An internet connection uses the endpoints of the virtual machine in conjunction with the public virtual IP address of the server.
trans-unit.target: An internet connection uses the endpoints of the virtual machine in conjunction with the public virtual IP address of the server.

trans-unit.source: A VPN connection uses the internal IP address of the server together with the endpoint private ports.
trans-unit.target: A VPN connection uses the internal IP address of the server together with the endpoint private ports.

trans-unit.source: It's a one-time decision to decide whether to connect (control and replication data) from your on-premises servers to the various component servers (configuration server, master target server) running in Azure over a VPN connection or the internet.
trans-unit.target: It's a one-time decision to decide whether to connect (control and replication data) from your on-premises servers to the various component servers (configuration server, master target server) running in Azure over a VPN connection or the internet.

trans-unit.source: You can't change this setting afterwards.
trans-unit.target: You can't change this setting afterwards.

trans-unit.source: If you do you'll need to redeploy the scenario and reprotect your machines.
trans-unit.target: If you do you'll need to redeploy the scenario and reprotect your machines.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Deploy the master target server
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Deploy the master target server

trans-unit.source: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources, click Deploy master target server.
trans-unit.target: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources, click Deploy master target server.

trans-unit.source: Specify the master target server details and credentials.
trans-unit.target: Specify the master target server details and credentials.

trans-unit.source: The server will be deployed in the same Azure network as the configuration server you register it to.
trans-unit.target: The server will be deployed in the same Azure network as the configuration server you register it to.

trans-unit.source: When you click to complete an Azure virtual machine will be created with a Windows or Linux gallery image.
trans-unit.target: When you click to complete an Azure virtual machine will be created with a Windows or Linux gallery image.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Target server settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Target server settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that the first four IP addresses in any subnet are reserved for internal Azure usage.
trans-unit.target: Note that the first four IP addresses in any subnet are reserved for internal Azure usage.

trans-unit.source: Specify any other available IP address.
trans-unit.target: Specify any other available IP address.

trans-unit.source: Select Standard DS4 when configuring protection for workloads which require consistent high IO performance and low latency in order to host IO intensive workloads using <link><linkText>Premium Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Select Standard DS4 when configuring protection for workloads which require consistent high IO performance and low latency in order to host IO intensive workloads using <link><linkText>Premium Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A Windows master target server virtual machine is created with these endpoints (Public endpoints are created only if your deployment type is Public Internet):
trans-unit.target: A Windows master target server virtual machine is created with these endpoints (Public endpoints are created only if your deployment type is Public Internet):

trans-unit.source: Custom: Public port is used by the process server to send replication data over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Custom: Public port is used by the process server to send replication data over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Private port 9443 is used by the process server to send replication data to the master target server over VPN.
trans-unit.target: Private port 9443 is used by the process server to send replication data to the master target server over VPN.

trans-unit.source: Custom1: Public port is used by the process server to send control meta-data over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Custom1: Public port is used by the process server to send control meta-data over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Private port 9080 is used by process server to send control meta-data to the master target server over VPN.
trans-unit.target: Private port 9080 is used by process server to send control meta-data to the master target server over VPN.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell: Private port 5986
trans-unit.target: PowerShell: Private port 5986

trans-unit.source: Remote desktop: Private port 3389
trans-unit.target: Remote desktop: Private port 3389

trans-unit.source: A Linux master target server virtual machine is created with these endpoints (Public endpoints are created only if your deployment type is Public Internet):
trans-unit.target: A Linux master target server virtual machine is created with these endpoints (Public endpoints are created only if your deployment type is Public Internet):

trans-unit.source: Custom: Public port is used by the process server to send replication data over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Custom: Public port is used by the process server to send replication data over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Private port 9443 is used by the process server to send replication data to the master target server over VPN.
trans-unit.target: Private port 9443 is used by the process server to send replication data to the master target server over VPN.

trans-unit.source: Custom1: Public port is used by the process server to send control meta-data over the internet.
trans-unit.target: Custom1: Public port is used by the process server to send control meta-data over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Private port 9080 is used by the process server to send control data to the master target server over VPN
trans-unit.target: Private port 9080 is used by the process server to send control data to the master target server over VPN

trans-unit.source: SSH: Private port 22
trans-unit.target: SSH: Private port 22

trans-unit.source: Don't delete or change the public or private port number of any of the endpoints created during the master target server deployment.
trans-unit.target: Don't delete or change the public or private port number of any of the endpoints created during the master target server deployment.

trans-unit.source: In Virtual Machines wait for the virtual machine to start.
trans-unit.target: In Virtual Machines wait for the virtual machine to start.

trans-unit.source: If you've configured the server with Windows note down the remote desktop details.
trans-unit.target: If you've configured the server with Windows note down the remote desktop details.

trans-unit.source: If you configured with Linux and you're connecting over VPN note the internal IP address of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you configured with Linux and you're connecting over VPN note the internal IP address of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you're connecting over the internet note the public IP address.
trans-unit.target: If you're connecting over the internet note the public IP address.

trans-unit.source: Log onto the server to complete installation and register it with the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: Log onto the server to complete installation and register it with the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: If you're running Windows:
trans-unit.target: If you're running Windows:

trans-unit.source: Initiate a remote desktop connection to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Initiate a remote desktop connection to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The first time you log on a script will run in a PowerShell window.
trans-unit.target: The first time you log on a script will run in a PowerShell window.

trans-unit.source: Don't close it.
trans-unit.target: Don't close it.

trans-unit.source: When it finishes the Host Agent Config tool opens automatically to register the server.
trans-unit.target: When it finishes the Host Agent Config tool opens automatically to register the server.

trans-unit.source: In Host Agent Config specify the internal IP address of the configuration server and port 443.
trans-unit.target: In Host Agent Config specify the internal IP address of the configuration server and port 443.

trans-unit.source: You can use the internal address and private port 443 even if you're not connecting over VPN because the virtual machine is attached to the same Azure network as the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: You can use the internal address and private port 443 even if you're not connecting over VPN because the virtual machine is attached to the same Azure network as the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: Leave Use HTTPS enabled.
trans-unit.target: Leave Use HTTPS enabled.

trans-unit.source: Enter the passphrase for the configuration server that you noted earlier.
trans-unit.target: Enter the passphrase for the configuration server that you noted earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to register server.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to register server.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can ignore the NAT options on the page.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can ignore the NAT options on the page.

trans-unit.source: They're not used.
trans-unit.target: They're not used.

trans-unit.source: If your estimated retention drive requirement is more than 1 TB you can configure the retention volume (R:) using a virtual disk and <link><linkText>storage spaces</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: If your estimated retention drive requirement is more than 1 TB you can configure the retention volume (R:) using a virtual disk and <link><linkText>storage spaces</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Windows master target server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Windows master target server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you're running Linux:
trans-unit.target: If you're running Linux:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have installed the latest Linux Integration Services (LIS) installed before you install the Master target server software.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have installed the latest Linux Integration Services (LIS) installed before you install the Master target server software.

trans-unit.source: You can find the latest version of LIS along with instructions on how to install <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can find the latest version of LIS along with instructions on how to install <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Restart the machine after the LIS install.
trans-unit.target: Restart the machine after the LIS install.

trans-unit.source: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources click Download and Install additional software (only for Linux Master Target Server) to download the Linux master target server package. Copy the downloaded tar file to the virtual machine using an sftp client. Alternatively you can log in to the deployed linux master target server and use wget http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=529757&clcid=0x409 to download the the file.
trans-unit.target: In Prepare Target(Azure) Resources click Download and Install additional software (only for Linux Master Target Server) to download the Linux master target server package. Copy the downloaded tar file to the virtual machine using an sftp client. Alternatively you can log in to the deployed linux master target server and use wget http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=529757&clcid=0x409 to download the the file.

trans-unit.source: Log into the server using a Secure Shell client.
trans-unit.target: Log into the server using a Secure Shell client.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you're connected to the Azure network over VPN use the internal IP address.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you're connected to the Azure network over VPN use the internal IP address.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise use the external IP address and the SSH public endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise use the external IP address and the SSH public endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Extract the files from the gzipped installer by running: tar –xvzf Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.4.0.0_RHEL6-64*
trans-unit.target: Extract the files from the gzipped installer by running: tar –xvzf Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.4.0.0_RHEL6-64*

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linux master target server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linux master target server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make sure you're in the directory to which you extracted the contents of the tar file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you're in the directory to which you extracted the contents of the tar file.

trans-unit.source: Copy the configuration server passphrase to a local file using the command **echo ** >passphrase.txt**
trans-unit.target: Copy the configuration server passphrase to a local file using the command **echo ** >passphrase.txt**

trans-unit.source: Run the command “**sudo ./install -t both -a host -R MasterTarget -d /usr/local/ASR -i ** -p 443 -s y -c https -P passphrase.txt**”.
trans-unit.target: Run the command “**sudo ./install -t both -a host -R MasterTarget -d /usr/local/ASR -i ** -p 443 -s y -c https -P passphrase.txt**”.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register target server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register target server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Wait for a few minutes (10-15) and on the Servers > Configuration Servers page check that the master target server is listed as registered on the Server Details tab.
trans-unit.target: Wait for a few minutes (10-15) and on the Servers > Configuration Servers page check that the master target server is listed as registered on the Server Details tab.

trans-unit.source: If you're running Linux and it didn't register run the host config tool again from /usr/local/ASR/Vx/bin/hostconfigcli.
trans-unit.target: If you're running Linux and it didn't register run the host config tool again from /usr/local/ASR/Vx/bin/hostconfigcli.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to set access permissions by running chmod as root.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to set access permissions by running chmod as root.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Verify target server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Verify target server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Please note that it can take up to 15 minutes after registration is complete for the master target server to be listed under the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: Please note that it can take up to 15 minutes after registration is complete for the master target server to be listed under the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To update immediately, refresh the configuration server by clicking on the refresh button at the bottom of the configuration servers page.
trans-unit.target: To update immediately, refresh the configuration server by clicking on the refresh button at the bottom of the configuration servers page.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Deploy the on-premises process server
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Deploy the on-premises process server

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you configure a static IP address on the process server so that it's guaranteed to be persistent across reboots.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you configure a static IP address on the process server so that it's guaranteed to be persistent across reboots.

trans-unit.source: Click Quick Start > Install Process Server on-premises > Download and install the process server.
trans-unit.target: Click Quick Start > Install Process Server on-premises > Download and install the process server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install process server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install process server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the downloaded zip file to the server on which you're going to install the process server.
trans-unit.target: Copy the downloaded zip file to the server on which you're going to install the process server.

trans-unit.source: The zip file contains two installation files:
trans-unit.target: The zip file contains two installation files:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft-ASR_CX_TP_8.4.0.0_Windows*
trans-unit.target: Microsoft-ASR_CX_TP_8.4.0.0_Windows*

trans-unit.source: Microsoft-ASR_CX_8.4.0.0_Windows*
trans-unit.target: Microsoft-ASR_CX_8.4.0.0_Windows*

trans-unit.source: Unzip the archive and copy the installation files to a location on the server.
trans-unit.target: Unzip the archive and copy the installation files to a location on the server.

trans-unit.source: Run the Microsoft-ASR_CX_TP_8.4.0.0_Windows* installation file and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Run the Microsoft-ASR_CX_TP_8.4.0.0_Windows* installation file and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: This installs third-party components needed for the deployment.
trans-unit.target: This installs third-party components needed for the deployment.

trans-unit.source: Then run Microsoft-ASR_CX_8.4.0.0_Windows*.
trans-unit.target: Then run Microsoft-ASR_CX_8.4.0.0_Windows*.

trans-unit.source: On the Server Mode page select Process Server.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Mode page select Process Server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Selection Mode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Selection Mode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Environment Details page do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the Environment Details page do the following:

trans-unit.source: If you want to protect VMware virtual machines click Yes
trans-unit.target: If you want to protect VMware virtual machines click Yes

trans-unit.source: If you only want to protect physical servers and thus don't need VMware vCLI installed on the process server.
trans-unit.target: If you only want to protect physical servers and thus don't need VMware vCLI installed on the process server.

trans-unit.source: Click No and continue.
trans-unit.target: Click No and continue.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note the following when installing VMware vCLI:
trans-unit.target: Note the following when installing VMware vCLI:

trans-unit.source: Only VMware vSphere CLI 5.5.0 is supported.
trans-unit.target: Only VMware vSphere CLI 5.5.0 is supported.

trans-unit.source: The process server doesn't work with other versions or updates of vSphere CLI.
trans-unit.target: The process server doesn't work with other versions or updates of vSphere CLI.

trans-unit.source: Download vSphere CLI 5.5.0 from <link><linkText>here.</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Download vSphere CLI 5.5.0 from <link><linkText>here.</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If you installed vSphere CLI just before you started installing the process server, and setup doesn't detect it, wait up to five minutes before you try setup again.
trans-unit.target: If you installed vSphere CLI just before you started installing the process server, and setup doesn't detect it, wait up to five minutes before you try setup again.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that all the environment variables needed for vSphere CLI detection have been initialized correctly.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that all the environment variables needed for vSphere CLI detection have been initialized correctly.

trans-unit.source: In NIC Selection for Process Server select the network adapter that the process server should use.
trans-unit.target: In NIC Selection for Process Server select the network adapter that the process server should use.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select adapter</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select adapter</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Configuration Server Details:
trans-unit.target: In Configuration Server Details:

trans-unit.source: For the IP address and port, if you're connecting over VPN specify the internal IP address of the configuration server and 443 for the port.
trans-unit.target: For the IP address and port, if you're connecting over VPN specify the internal IP address of the configuration server and 443 for the port.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise specify the public virtual IP address and mapped public HTTP endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise specify the public virtual IP address and mapped public HTTP endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Type in the passphrase of the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: Type in the passphrase of the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: Clear Verify Mobility service software signature if you want to disable verification when you use automatic push to install the service.
trans-unit.target: Clear Verify Mobility service software signature if you want to disable verification when you use automatic push to install the service.

trans-unit.source: Signature verification needs internet connectivity from the process server.
trans-unit.target: Signature verification needs internet connectivity from the process server.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Select Installation Drive select a cache drive.
trans-unit.target: In Select Installation Drive select a cache drive.

trans-unit.source: The process server needs a cache drive with at least 600 GB of free space.
trans-unit.target: The process server needs a cache drive with at least 600 GB of free space.

trans-unit.source: Then click Install.
trans-unit.target: Then click Install.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register configuration server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that you might need to restart the server to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Note that you might need to restart the server to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: In Configuration Server > Server Details check that the process server appears and is registered successfully in the vault.
trans-unit.target: In Configuration Server > Server Details check that the process server appears and is registered successfully in the vault.

trans-unit.source: It can take up to 15 minutes after registration is complete for the process server to appear as listed under the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: It can take up to 15 minutes after registration is complete for the process server to appear as listed under the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To update immediately, refresh the configuration server by clicking on the refresh button at the bottom of the configuration server page
trans-unit.target: To update immediately, refresh the configuration server by clicking on the refresh button at the bottom of the configuration server page

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Validate process server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Validate process server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you didn't disable signature verification for the Mobility service when you registered the process server you can do it later as follows:
trans-unit.target: If you didn't disable signature verification for the Mobility service when you registered the process server you can do it later as follows:

trans-unit.source: Log onto the process server as an administrator and open the file C:\pushinstallsvc\pushinstaller.conf for editing.
trans-unit.target: Log onto the process server as an administrator and open the file C:\pushinstallsvc\pushinstaller.conf for editing.

trans-unit.source: Under the section [PushInstaller.transport] add this line: SignatureVerificationChecks=”0”.
trans-unit.target: Under the section [PushInstaller.transport] add this line: SignatureVerificationChecks=”0”.

trans-unit.source: Save and close the file.
trans-unit.target: Save and close the file.

trans-unit.source: Restart the InMage PushInstall service.
trans-unit.target: Restart the InMage PushInstall service.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Install latest updates
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Install latest updates

trans-unit.source: Before proceeding, ensure that you have the latest updates installed.
trans-unit.target: Before proceeding, ensure that you have the latest updates installed.

trans-unit.source: Remember to install the updates in the following order:
trans-unit.target: Remember to install the updates in the following order:

trans-unit.source: Configuration server
trans-unit.target: Configuration server

trans-unit.source: Process server
trans-unit.target: Process server

trans-unit.source: Master target server
trans-unit.target: Master target server

trans-unit.source: You can get the updates on the Site Recovery *Dashboard *.
trans-unit.target: You can get the updates on the Site Recovery *Dashboard *.

trans-unit.source: For Linux installation extract the files from the gzipped installer and run the command “sudo ./install” to install the update
trans-unit.target: For Linux installation extract the files from the gzipped installer and run the command “sudo ./install” to install the update

trans-unit.source: If you are running virtual machines or physical servers that already have the Mobility service installed, you can get updates for the service as follows:
trans-unit.target: If you are running virtual machines or physical servers that already have the Mobility service installed, you can get updates for the service as follows:

trans-unit.source: Either download updates for the service as follows:
trans-unit.target: Either download updates for the service as follows:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Windows Server (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Windows Server (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>CentOS 6.4,6.5,6.6 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>CentOS 6.4,6.5,6.6 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Oracle Enterprise Linux 6.4,6.5 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Oracle Enterprise Linux 6.4,6.5 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>SUSE Linux Enterprise Server SP3 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>SUSE Linux Enterprise Server SP3 (64 bit only)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Alternatively after updating the process server you can get the updated version of the Mobility service from the C:\pushinstallsvc\repository folder on the process server.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively after updating the process server you can get the updated version of the Mobility service from the C:\pushinstallsvc\repository folder on the process server.

trans-unit.source: If you have a an already protected machine with an older version of the Mobility service installed, you could also automatically upgrade the Mobility service on the protected machines from the management portal.
trans-unit.target: If you have a an already protected machine with an older version of the Mobility service installed, you could also automatically upgrade the Mobility service on the protected machines from the management portal.

trans-unit.source: To do this, select the protection group to which the machine belongs, highlight the protected machine and click on the Update Mobility service button at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: To do this, select the protection group to which the machine belongs, highlight the protected machine and click on the Update Mobility service button at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: The Update Mobility Service button will be activated only if a newer version of the Mobility Service is available.
trans-unit.target: The Update Mobility Service button will be activated only if a newer version of the Mobility Service is available.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure that the Process server is running the latest version of the Process server software before updating the mobility service.
trans-unit.target: Please ensure that the Process server is running the latest version of the Process server software before updating the mobility service.

trans-unit.source: The protected server needs to meet all the <link><linkText>automatic push-installation prerequisites</linkText><title></title></link> in order for update mobility service to work.
trans-unit.target: The protected server needs to meet all the <link><linkText>automatic push-installation prerequisites</linkText><title></title></link> in order for update mobility service to work.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select vCenter server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select vCenter server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Select accounts specify the administrator account to be used to update the mobility service on the protected server.
trans-unit.target: In Select accounts specify the administrator account to be used to update the mobility service on the protected server.

trans-unit.source: Click OK and wait for the triggered job to complete.
trans-unit.target: Click OK and wait for the triggered job to complete.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Add vCenter servers or ESXi hosts
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Add vCenter servers or ESXi hosts

trans-unit.source: On the Servers > Configuration Servers tab select the configuration server and click ADD VCENTER SERVER to add a vCenter server or ESXi host.
trans-unit.target: On the Servers > Configuration Servers tab select the configuration server and click ADD VCENTER SERVER to add a vCenter server or ESXi host.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select vCenter server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select vCenter server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify details for the vCenter server or ESXi host and select the process server that will be used to discover it.
trans-unit.target: Specify details for the vCenter server or ESXi host and select the process server that will be used to discover it.

trans-unit.source: If the vCenter server isn't running on the default 443 port specify the port number on which the vCenter server is running.
trans-unit.target: If the vCenter server isn't running on the default 443 port specify the port number on which the vCenter server is running.

trans-unit.source: The process server must be on the same network as the vCenter server/ESXi host and should have VMware vSphere CLI 5.5.0 installed.
trans-unit.target: The process server must be on the same network as the vCenter server/ESXi host and should have VMware vSphere CLI 5.5.0 installed.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>vCenter server settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>vCenter server settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After discovery is completed the vCenter server will be listed under the configuration server details.
trans-unit.target: After discovery is completed the vCenter server will be listed under the configuration server details.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>vCenter server settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>vCenter server settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you're using a non-administrator account to add the vCenter server or ESXi host, make sure the account has the following privileges:
trans-unit.target: If you're using a non-administrator account to add the vCenter server or ESXi host, make sure the account has the following privileges:

trans-unit.source: vCenter accounts should have Datacenter, Datastore, Folder, Host, Network, Resource, Storage views, Virtual machine and vSphere Distributed Switch privileges enabled.
trans-unit.target: vCenter accounts should have Datacenter, Datastore, Folder, Host, Network, Resource, Storage views, Virtual machine and vSphere Distributed Switch privileges enabled.

trans-unit.source: ESXi host accounts should have the Datacenter, Datastore, Folder, Host, Network, Resource, Virtual machine and vSphere Distributed Switch privileges enabled
trans-unit.target: ESXi host accounts should have the Datacenter, Datastore, Folder, Host, Network, Resource, Virtual machine and vSphere Distributed Switch privileges enabled

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Create a protection group
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Create a protection group

trans-unit.source: Open Protected Items > Protection Group and click to add a protection group.
trans-unit.target: Open Protected Items > Protection Group and click to add a protection group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create protection group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create protection group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Protection Group Settings page specify a name for the group and select the configuration server on which you want to create the group.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Protection Group Settings page specify a name for the group and select the configuration server on which you want to create the group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Protection group settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Protection group settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Replication Settings page configure the replication settings that will be used for all the machines in the group.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Replication Settings page configure the replication settings that will be used for all the machines in the group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Protection group replication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Protection group replication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Settings:
trans-unit.target: Settings:

trans-unit.source: Multi VM consistency: If you turn this on it creates shared application-consistent recovery points across the machines in the protection group.
trans-unit.target: Multi VM consistency: If you turn this on it creates shared application-consistent recovery points across the machines in the protection group.

trans-unit.source: This setting is most relevant when all of the machines in the protection group are running the same workload.
trans-unit.target: This setting is most relevant when all of the machines in the protection group are running the same workload.

trans-unit.source: All machines will be recovered to the same data point.
trans-unit.target: All machines will be recovered to the same data point.

trans-unit.source: Only available for Windows servers.
trans-unit.target: Only available for Windows servers.

trans-unit.source: RPO threshold: Alerts will be generated when the continuous data protection replication RPO exceeds the configured RPO threshold value.
trans-unit.target: RPO threshold: Alerts will be generated when the continuous data protection replication RPO exceeds the configured RPO threshold value.

trans-unit.source: Recovery point retention: Specifies the retention window.
trans-unit.target: Recovery point retention: Specifies the retention window.

trans-unit.source: Protected machines can be recovered to any point within this window.
trans-unit.target: Protected machines can be recovered to any point within this window.

trans-unit.source: Application-consistent snapshot frequency: Specifies how frequently recovery points containing application-consistent snapshots will be created.
trans-unit.target: Application-consistent snapshot frequency: Specifies how frequently recovery points containing application-consistent snapshots will be created.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the protection group as they're created on the Protected Items page.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the protection group as they're created on the Protected Items page.

trans-unit.source: Step 8: Set up machines you want to protect
trans-unit.target: Step 8: Set up machines you want to protect

trans-unit.source: You'll need to install the Mobility service on virtual machines and physical servers you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to install the Mobility service on virtual machines and physical servers you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: You can do this in two ways:
trans-unit.target: You can do this in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Automatically push and install the service on each machine from the process server.
trans-unit.target: Automatically push and install the service on each machine from the process server.

trans-unit.source: Manually install the service.
trans-unit.target: Manually install the service.

trans-unit.source: Install the Mobility service automatically
trans-unit.target: Install the Mobility service automatically

trans-unit.source: When you add machines to a protection group the Mobility service is automatically pushed and installed on each machine by the process server.
trans-unit.target: When you add machines to a protection group the Mobility service is automatically pushed and installed on each machine by the process server.

trans-unit.source: Automatically push install the mobility service on Windows servers:
trans-unit.target: Automatically push install the mobility service on Windows servers:

trans-unit.source: Install the latest updates for the process server as described in <link><linkText>Step 5: Install latest updates</linkText><title></title></link>, and make sure that the process server is available.
trans-unit.target: Install the latest updates for the process server as described in <link><linkText>Step 5: Install latest updates</linkText><title></title></link>, and make sure that the process server is available.

trans-unit.source: Ensure there's network connectivity between the source machine and the process server, and that the source machine is accessible from the process server.
trans-unit.target: Ensure there's network connectivity between the source machine and the process server, and that the source machine is accessible from the process server.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Windows firewall to allow File and Printer Sharing and Windows Management Instrumentation.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Windows firewall to allow File and Printer Sharing and Windows Management Instrumentation.

trans-unit.source: Under Windows Firewall settings, select the option “Allow an app or feature through Firewall” and select the applications as shown in the picture below.
trans-unit.target: Under Windows Firewall settings, select the option “Allow an app or feature through Firewall” and select the applications as shown in the picture below.

trans-unit.source: For machines that belong to a domain you can configure the firewall policy with a Group Policy Object.
trans-unit.target: For machines that belong to a domain you can configure the firewall policy with a Group Policy Object.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Firewall settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Firewall settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The account used to perform the push installation must be in the Administrators group on the machine you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: The account used to perform the push installation must be in the Administrators group on the machine you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: These credentials are only used for push installation of the Mobility service and you'll provide them when you add a machine to a protection group.
trans-unit.target: These credentials are only used for push installation of the Mobility service and you'll provide them when you add a machine to a protection group.

trans-unit.source: If the provided account isn't a domain account you'll need to disable Remote User Access control on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: If the provided account isn't a domain account you'll need to disable Remote User Access control on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: To do this add the LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy DWORD registry entry with a value of 1 under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System.
trans-unit.target: To do this add the LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy DWORD registry entry with a value of 1 under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System.

trans-unit.source: To add the registry entry from a CLI open cmd or powershell and enter **REG ADD HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy /t REG_DWORD /d 1**.
trans-unit.target: To add the registry entry from a CLI open cmd or powershell and enter **REG ADD HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy /t REG_DWORD /d 1**.

trans-unit.source: Automatically push install the mobility service on Linux servers:
trans-unit.target: Automatically push install the mobility service on Linux servers:

trans-unit.source: Install the latest updates for the process server as described in <link><linkText>Step 5: Install latest updates</linkText><title></title></link>, and make sure that the process server is available.
trans-unit.target: Install the latest updates for the process server as described in <link><linkText>Step 5: Install latest updates</linkText><title></title></link>, and make sure that the process server is available.

trans-unit.source: Ensure there's network connectivity between the source machine and the process server, and that the source machine is accessible from the process server.
trans-unit.target: Ensure there's network connectivity between the source machine and the process server, and that the source machine is accessible from the process server.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the account is a root user on the source Linux server.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the account is a root user on the source Linux server.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the /etc/hosts file on the source Linux server contains entries that map the local host name to IP addresses associated with all NICs.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the /etc/hosts file on the source Linux server contains entries that map the local host name to IP addresses associated with all NICs.

trans-unit.source: Install the latest openssh, openssh-server, openssl packages on the machine you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: Install the latest openssh, openssh-server, openssl packages on the machine you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: Ensure SSH is enabled and running on port 22.
trans-unit.target: Ensure SSH is enabled and running on port 22.

trans-unit.source: Enable SFTP subsystem and password authentication in the sshd_config file as follows:
trans-unit.target: Enable SFTP subsystem and password authentication in the sshd_config file as follows:

trans-unit.source: a) Log in as root.
trans-unit.target: a) Log in as root.

trans-unit.source: b) In the file /etc/ssh/sshd_config file, find the line that begins with PasswordAuthentication.
trans-unit.target: b) In the file /etc/ssh/sshd_config file, find the line that begins with PasswordAuthentication.

trans-unit.source: c) Uncomment the line and change the value from “no” to “yes”.
trans-unit.target: c) Uncomment the line and change the value from “no” to “yes”.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linux mobility</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linux mobility</linkText>

trans-unit.source: d) Find the line that begins with Subsystem and uncomment the line.
trans-unit.target: d) Find the line that begins with Subsystem and uncomment the line.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linux push mobility</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linux push mobility</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Ensure the source machine Linux variant is supported.
trans-unit.target: Ensure the source machine Linux variant is supported.

trans-unit.target: Install the Mobility service manually

trans-unit.target: The software packages used to install the Mobility service are on the process server in C:\pushinstallsvc\repository.

trans-unit.target: Log onto the process server and copy the appropriate installation package to the source machine based on the table below:-

trans-unit.target: C:\pushinstallsvc\repository\Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.4.0.0_Windows_GA_28Jul2015_release.exe

trans-unit.source: To install the Mobility service manually on a Windows server, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the Mobility service manually on a Windows server, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy the Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.4.0.0_Windows_GA_28Jul2015_release.exe package from the process server directory path listed in the table above to the source machine.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.4.0.0_Windows_GA_28Jul2015_release.exe package from the process server directory path listed in the table above to the source machine.

trans-unit.source: Install the Mobility service by running the executable on the source machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the Mobility service by running the executable on the source machine.

trans-unit.source: Follow the installer instructions.
trans-unit.target: Follow the installer instructions.

trans-unit.source: Select Mobility service as the role and click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Mobility service as the role and click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install mobility service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install mobility service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Leave the installation directory as the default installation path and click Install.
trans-unit.target: Leave the installation directory as the default installation path and click Install.

trans-unit.source: In Host Agent Config specify the IP address and HTTPS port of the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: In Host Agent Config specify the IP address and HTTPS port of the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: If you're connecting over the internet specify the public virtual IP address and public HTTPS endpoint as the port.
trans-unit.target: If you're connecting over the internet specify the public virtual IP address and public HTTPS endpoint as the port.

trans-unit.source: If you're connecting over VPN specify the internal IP address and 443 for the port.
trans-unit.target: If you're connecting over VPN specify the internal IP address and 443 for the port.

trans-unit.source: Leave Use HTTPS checked.
trans-unit.target: Leave Use HTTPS checked.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install mobility service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install mobility service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify the configuration server passphrase and click OK to register the Mobility service with the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: Specify the configuration server passphrase and click OK to register the Mobility service with the configuration server.

trans-unit.target: To run from the command line:

trans-unit.source: Copy the passphrase from the CX to the file "C:\connection.passphrase" on the server and run this command.
trans-unit.target: Copy the passphrase from the CX to the file "C:\connection.passphrase" on the server and run this command.

trans-unit.target: In our example CX i 104.40.75.37 and the HTTPS port is 62519:

trans-unit.source: C:\Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.2.0.0_Windows_PREVIEW_20Mar2015_Release.exe" -ip 104.40.75.37 -port 62519 -mode UA /LOG="C:\stdout.txt" /DIR="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Azure Site Recovery" /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /norestart -usesysvolumes /CommunicationMode https /PassphrasePath "C:\connection.passphrase"
trans-unit.target: C:\Microsoft-ASR_UA_8.2.0.0_Windows_PREVIEW_20Mar2015_Release.exe" -ip 104.40.75.37 -port 62519 -mode UA /LOG="C:\stdout.txt" /DIR="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Azure Site Recovery" /VERYSILENT /SUPPRESSMSGBOXES /norestart -usesysvolumes /CommunicationMode https /PassphrasePath "C:\connection.passphrase"

trans-unit.target: Copy the appropriate tar archive based on the table above, from the process server to the source machine.
