trans-unit.source: Step 9: Enable protection
trans-unit.target: Step 9: Enable protection

trans-unit.source: To enable protection you add virtual machines and physical servers to a protection group.
trans-unit.target: To enable protection you add virtual machines and physical servers to a protection group.

trans-unit.source: Before you start,note that:
trans-unit.target: Before you start,note that:

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines are discovered every 15 minutes and it can take up to 15 minutes for them to appear in Azure Site Recovery after discovery.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines are discovered every 15 minutes and it can take up to 15 minutes for them to appear in Azure Site Recovery after discovery.

trans-unit.source: Environment changes on the virtual machine (such as VMware tools installation) can also take up to 15 minutes to be updated in Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Environment changes on the virtual machine (such as VMware tools installation) can also take up to 15 minutes to be updated in Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: You can check the last discovered time in the LAST CONTACT AT field for the vCenter server/ESXi host on the Configuration Servers page.
trans-unit.target: You can check the last discovered time in the LAST CONTACT AT field for the vCenter server/ESXi host on the Configuration Servers page.

trans-unit.source: If you have a protection group already created and add a vCenter Server or ESXi host after that, it takes fifteen minutes for the Azure Site Recovery portal to refresh and for virtual machines to be listed in the Add machines to a protection group dialog.
trans-unit.target: If you have a protection group already created and add a vCenter Server or ESXi host after that, it takes fifteen minutes for the Azure Site Recovery portal to refresh and for virtual machines to be listed in the Add machines to a protection group dialog.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to proceed immediately with adding machines to protection group without waiting for the scheduled discovery, highlight the configuration server (don’t click it) and click the Refresh button.
trans-unit.target: If you would like to proceed immediately with adding machines to protection group without waiting for the scheduled discovery, highlight the configuration server (don’t click it) and click the Refresh button.

trans-unit.source: When you add virtual machines or physical machines to a protection group, the process server automatically pushes and installs the Mobility service on the source server if the it isn't already installed.
trans-unit.target: When you add virtual machines or physical machines to a protection group, the process server automatically pushes and installs the Mobility service on the source server if the it isn't already installed.

trans-unit.source: For the automatic push mechanism to work make sure you've set up your protected machines as described in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: For the automatic push mechanism to work make sure you've set up your protected machines as described in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Add machines as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add machines as follows:

trans-unit.source: Protected Items > Protection Group > Machines tab.
trans-unit.target: Protected Items > Protection Group > Machines tab.

trans-unit.source: Click ADD MACHINES.
trans-unit.target: Click ADD MACHINES.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice we recommend that protection groups should mirror your workloads so that you add machines running a specific application to the same group.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice we recommend that protection groups should mirror your workloads so that you add machines running a specific application to the same group.

trans-unit.source: In Select Virtual Machines if you're protecting physical servers, in the Add Physical Machines wizard provide the IP address and friendly name.
trans-unit.target: In Select Virtual Machines if you're protecting physical servers, in the Add Physical Machines wizard provide the IP address and friendly name.

trans-unit.source: Then select the operating system family.
trans-unit.target: Then select the operating system family.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Select Virtual Machines if you're protecting VMware virtual machines, select a vCenter server that's managing your virtual machines (or the EXSi host on which they're running), and then select the machines.
trans-unit.target: In Select Virtual Machines if you're protecting VMware virtual machines, select a vCenter server that's managing your virtual machines (or the EXSi host on which they're running), and then select the machines.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Specify Target Resources select the master target servers and storage to use for replication and select whether the settings should be used for all workloads.
trans-unit.target: In Specify Target Resources select the master target servers and storage to use for replication and select whether the settings should be used for all workloads.

trans-unit.source: Select <link><linkText>Premium Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link> while configuring protection for workloads which require consistent high IO performance and low latency in order to host IO intensive workloads.
trans-unit.target: Select <link><linkText>Premium Storage Account</linkText><title></title></link> while configuring protection for workloads which require consistent high IO performance and low latency in order to host IO intensive workloads.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a Premium Storage account for your workload disks, you need to use the Master Target of DS-series.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a Premium Storage account for your workload disks, you need to use the Master Target of DS-series.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use Premium Storage disks with Master Target of non-DS-series.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use Premium Storage disks with Master Target of non-DS-series.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>vCenter server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>vCenter server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Specify Accounts select the account you want to use for installing the Mobility service on protected machines.
trans-unit.target: In Specify Accounts select the account you want to use for installing the Mobility service on protected machines.

trans-unit.source: The account credentials are needed for automatic installation of the Mobility service.
trans-unit.target: The account credentials are needed for automatic installation of the Mobility service.

trans-unit.source: If you can't select an account make sure you set one up as described in Step 2.
trans-unit.target: If you can't select an account make sure you set one up as described in Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Note that this account can't be accessed by Azure.
trans-unit.target: Note that this account can't be accessed by Azure.

trans-unit.source: For Windows server the account should have administrator privileges on the source server.
trans-unit.target: For Windows server the account should have administrator privileges on the source server.

trans-unit.source: For Linux the account must be root.
trans-unit.target: For Linux the account must be root.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linux credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linux credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to finish adding machines to the protection group and to start initial replication for each machine.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to finish adding machines to the protection group and to start initial replication for each machine.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor status on the Jobs page.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor status on the Jobs page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add V-Center server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In addition you can monitor protection status by clicking Protected Items > protection group name > Virtual Machines .
trans-unit.target: In addition you can monitor protection status by clicking Protected Items > protection group name > Virtual Machines .

trans-unit.source: After initial replication completes and the machines are synchronizing data they will show Protected status.
trans-unit.target: After initial replication completes and the machines are synchronizing data they will show Protected status.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machine jobs</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machine jobs</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Set protected machine properties
trans-unit.target: Set protected machine properties

trans-unit.source: After a machine has a Protected status you can configure its failover properties.
trans-unit.target: After a machine has a Protected status you can configure its failover properties.

trans-unit.source: In the protection group details select the machine and open the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: In the protection group details select the machine and open the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the name that will be given to the machine in Azure after failover and the Azure virtual machine size.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the name that will be given to the machine in Azure after failover and the Azure virtual machine size.

trans-unit.source: You can also select the Azure network to which the machine will be connected after failover.
trans-unit.target: You can also select the Azure network to which the machine will be connected after failover.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set virtual machine properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set virtual machine properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: The name of the Azure machine must comply with Azure requirements.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Azure machine must comply with Azure requirements.

trans-unit.source: By default replicated virtual machines in Azure aren't connected to an Azure network.
trans-unit.target: By default replicated virtual machines in Azure aren't connected to an Azure network.

trans-unit.source: If you want replicated virtual machines to communicate make sure to set the same Azure network for them.
trans-unit.target: If you want replicated virtual machines to communicate make sure to set the same Azure network for them.

trans-unit.source: If you resize a volume on a VMware virtual machine or physical server it goes into a critical state.
trans-unit.target: If you resize a volume on a VMware virtual machine or physical server it goes into a critical state.

trans-unit.source: If you do need to modify the size, do the following:
trans-unit.target: If you do need to modify the size, do the following:

trans-unit.source: a) Change the size setting.
trans-unit.target: a) Change the size setting.

trans-unit.source: b) In the Virtual Machines tab, select the virtual machine and click Remove.
trans-unit.target: b) In the Virtual Machines tab, select the virtual machine and click Remove.

trans-unit.source: c) In Remove Virtual Machine select the option Disable protection (use for recovery drill and volume resize).
trans-unit.target: c) In Remove Virtual Machine select the option Disable protection (use for recovery drill and volume resize).

trans-unit.source: This option disables protection but retains the recovery points in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This option disables protection but retains the recovery points in Azure.

trans-unit.source: d) Reenable protection for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: d) Reenable protection for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: When you reenable protection the data for the resized volume will be transferred to Azure.
trans-unit.target: When you reenable protection the data for the resized volume will be transferred to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Step 10: Run a failover
trans-unit.target: Step 10: Run a failover

trans-unit.source: Currently you can only run unplanned failovers for protected VMware virtual machines and physical servers.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can only run unplanned failovers for protected VMware virtual machines and physical servers.

trans-unit.source: Note the following:
trans-unit.target: Note the following:

trans-unit.source: Before you initiate a failover, ensure that the configuration and master target servers are running and healthy.
trans-unit.target: Before you initiate a failover, ensure that the configuration and master target servers are running and healthy.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise failover will fail.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise failover will fail.

trans-unit.source: Source machines aren't shut down as part of an unplanned failover.
trans-unit.target: Source machines aren't shut down as part of an unplanned failover.

trans-unit.source: Performing an unplanned failover stops data replication for the protected servers.
trans-unit.target: Performing an unplanned failover stops data replication for the protected servers.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to delete the machines from the protection group and add them again in order to start protecting machines again after the unplanned failover completes.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to delete the machines from the protection group and add them again in order to start protecting machines again after the unplanned failover completes.

trans-unit.source: If you want to fail over without losing any data, make sure that the primary site virtual machines are turned off before you initiate the failover.
trans-unit.target: If you want to fail over without losing any data, make sure that the primary site virtual machines are turned off before you initiate the failover.

trans-unit.source: On the Recovery Plans page and add a recovery plan.
trans-unit.target: On the Recovery Plans page and add a recovery plan.

trans-unit.source: Specify details for the plan and select Azure as the target.
trans-unit.target: Specify details for the plan and select Azure as the target.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure recovery plan</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure recovery plan</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Select Virtual Machine select a protection group and then select machines in the group to add to the recovery plan.
trans-unit.target: In Select Virtual Machine select a protection group and then select machines in the group to add to the recovery plan.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Read more</linkText><title></title></link> about recovery plans.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Read more</linkText><title></title></link> about recovery plans.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add virtual machines</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add virtual machines</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If needed you can customize the plan to create groups and sequence the order in which machines in the recovery plan are failed over.
trans-unit.target: If needed you can customize the plan to create groups and sequence the order in which machines in the recovery plan are failed over.

trans-unit.source: You can also add prompts for manual actions and scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can also add prompts for manual actions and scripts.

trans-unit.source: The scripts when recovering to Azure can be added by using <link><linkText>Azure Automation Runbooks</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The scripts when recovering to Azure can be added by using <link><linkText>Azure Automation Runbooks</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Recovery Plans page select the plan and click Unplanned Failover.
trans-unit.target: In the Recovery Plans page select the plan and click Unplanned Failover.

trans-unit.source: In Confirm Failover verify the failover direction (To Azure) and select the recovery point to fail over to.
trans-unit.target: In Confirm Failover verify the failover direction (To Azure) and select the recovery point to fail over to.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the failover job to complete and then verify that the failover worked as expected and that the replicated virtual machines start successfully in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the failover job to complete and then verify that the failover worked as expected and that the replicated virtual machines start successfully in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Step 11: Fail back failed over machines from Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 11: Fail back failed over machines from Azure

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn more</linkText><title></title></link> about how to bring your failed over machines running in Azure back to your on-premises environment.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn more</linkText><title></title></link> about how to bring your failed over machines running in Azure back to your on-premises environment.

trans-unit.source: Manage your process servers
trans-unit.target: Manage your process servers

trans-unit.source: The process server sends replication data to the master target server in Azure, and discovers new VMware virtual machines added to a vCenter server.
trans-unit.target: The process server sends replication data to the master target server in Azure, and discovers new VMware virtual machines added to a vCenter server.

trans-unit.source: In the following circumstances you might want to change the process server in your deployment:
trans-unit.target: In the following circumstances you might want to change the process server in your deployment:

trans-unit.source: If the current process server goes down
trans-unit.target: If the current process server goes down

trans-unit.source: If your recovery point objective (RPO) rises to an unacceptable level for your organization.
trans-unit.target: If your recovery point objective (RPO) rises to an unacceptable level for your organization.

trans-unit.source: If required you can move the replication of some or all of your on-premises VMware virtual machines and physical servers to a different process server.
trans-unit.target: If required you can move the replication of some or all of your on-premises VMware virtual machines and physical servers to a different process server.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Failure—If a process server fails or isn't available you can move protected machine replication to another process server.
trans-unit.target: Failure—If a process server fails or isn't available you can move protected machine replication to another process server.

trans-unit.source: Metadata of the source machine and replica machine will be moved to the new process server and data is resynchronized.
trans-unit.target: Metadata of the source machine and replica machine will be moved to the new process server and data is resynchronized.

trans-unit.source: The new process server will automatically connect to the vCenter server to perform automatic discovery.
trans-unit.target: The new process server will automatically connect to the vCenter server to perform automatic discovery.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the state of process servers on the Site Recovery dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the state of process servers on the Site Recovery dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Load balancing to adjust RPO—For improved load balancing you can select a different process server in the Site Recovery portal, and move replication of one or more machines to it for manual load balancing.
trans-unit.target: Load balancing to adjust RPO—For improved load balancing you can select a different process server in the Site Recovery portal, and move replication of one or more machines to it for manual load balancing.

trans-unit.source: In this case metadata of the selected source and replica machines is moved to the new process server.
trans-unit.target: In this case metadata of the selected source and replica machines is moved to the new process server.

trans-unit.source: The original process server remains connected to the vCenter server.
trans-unit.target: The original process server remains connected to the vCenter server.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the process server
trans-unit.target: Monitor the process server

trans-unit.source: If a process server is in a critical state a status warning will be displayed on the Site Recovery Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: If a process server is in a critical state a status warning will be displayed on the Site Recovery Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can click on the status to open the Events tab and then drill down to specific jobs on the Jobs tab.
trans-unit.target: You can click on the status to open the Events tab and then drill down to specific jobs on the Jobs tab.

trans-unit.source: Modify the process server used for replication
trans-unit.target: Modify the process server used for replication

trans-unit.source: Go to the CONFIGURATION SERVERS page under SERVERS
trans-unit.target: Go to the CONFIGURATION SERVERS page under SERVERS

trans-unit.source: Click on the name of the Configuration Server and go to Server Details.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name of the Configuration Server and go to Server Details.

trans-unit.source: In the Process Servers list click Change Process Server next to the server you want to modify.
trans-unit.target: In the Process Servers list click Change Process Server next to the server you want to modify.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Change Process Server 1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Change Process Server 1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Change Process Server dialog select the new server in Target Process Server, and then select the virtual machines that you want to replicate to the new server.
trans-unit.target: In the Change Process Server dialog select the new server in Target Process Server, and then select the virtual machines that you want to replicate to the new server.

trans-unit.source: click the information icon next to the server name to get information about it, including free space, used memory.
trans-unit.target: click the information icon next to the server name to get information about it, including free space, used memory.

trans-unit.source: The average space that will be required to replicate each selected virtual machine to the new process server is displayed to help you make load decisions.
trans-unit.target: The average space that will be required to replicate each selected virtual machine to the new process server is displayed to help you make load decisions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Change Process Server 2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Change Process Server 2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to begin replicating to the new process server.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to begin replicating to the new process server.

trans-unit.source: If you remove all virtual machines from a process server that was critical it should no longer display a critical warning in the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: If you remove all virtual machines from a process server that was critical it should no longer display a critical warning in the dashboard.
